title.native: 小林さんちのメイドラゴンＳ

description:
A strange turn of events leads the Dragon, Tohru, to work as Miss Kobayashi's maid. She occasionally (that's a lie, she often) causes trouble for her beloved Miss Kobayashi while blending into human society and splendidly (that's a lie, only mediocrely) carrying out her maid duties. Her fellow dragons, Kanna, Lucoa, Fafnir, and Elma all find their own places to fit in as well and enjoy interspecies interactions with the humans. Yet while they're all enjoying that laid-back and occasionally turbulent left, the threat of a new Dragon swoops down upon Miss Kobayashi.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: น้องเมดมังกรของคุณโคบายาชิ ภาค 2
Kobayashi-san Chi no Maid Dragon 2nd Season

tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

node.description: [Website](https://www.i-love-cool.com) | [Blog](http://ilovecool.blog35.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/coolkyou2) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/463912)

A prominent director and a key member of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

After graduating from Osaka Designers' College in the late '80s, Ishihara joined Kyoto Animation and began his career as an animator. In 1991, he made his debut as a director with [Shiawasette Naani](https://anilist.co/anime/13441/). After that, he switched his focus to directing. Back then Kyoto Animation was still a sub-contracting studio, so therefore Ishihara could only get a handful of opportunities directing. Some of the shows in which Ishihara got to direct multiple episodes were [Tenchi Muyou!](https://anilist.co/anime/696/), [Aka-chan to Boku](https://anilist.co/anime/1485/), [Hyper Police](https://anilist.co/anime/1180/), and [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He also storyboarded the majority of the episodes he directed.

In 2003, Kyoto Animation started their transformation into a full-fledged animation studio producing their first anime series, [Fullmetal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/). Ishihara directed and storyboarded the 7th episode of the show. Two years later in 2005, he made his proper directorial debut directing the studio's second TV show, [Air](https://anilist.co/anime/101/). The following year he directed the award winning anime series, [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/). From here Ishihara has gone on to direct multiple of Kyoto Animation's acclaimed works.

Yasuhiro Takemoto studied animation at the Yoyogi Animation Academy. After graduating, he started working at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation) for almost his entire animation career, joining the company in 1996. At the company, Yasuhiro was considered one of the most reliable and trustworthy members of the staff. [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/) was his directorial debut​ and [Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/Full-Metal-Panic-Fumoffu/) his first solo directorial debut.

He died in the arson attack at Kyoto Animation's Studio 1 on July 18, 2019.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山田由香)
Animator and character designer affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)
Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) since 1989.

Worked as an animator in the beginning of his career.
Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

A four-member Japanese pop band that formed in 2012 as an indie band. After releasing one album independently, they were signed in 2013 to Lantis. They released their debut single "Que Sera Sera" in August 2013. 

Fhána originally formed with [Junichi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/127344), Yuxuki Waga and Kevin Mitsunaga, and all three had previously been involved in separate indie bands. Fhána did not have a fixed vocalist at first, instead employing guest vocalists to sing the band's songs. Fhána released their independent album New World Line on May 18, 2012 featuring four guest vocalists: Makiko Naka, Towana, IA, and Aoi Tada. In late 2012, Towana joined Fhána as the official vocalist. Fhána was signed to Lantis in 2013 and released their major debut single "Que Sera Sera" on August 21, 2013; the song is used as the ending theme to the 2013 anime series The Eccentric Family (Uchouten Kazoku).

__Agency:__ Mausu Promotion

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - The Strongest Maid in History, Tohru! (Well, She is a Dragon)
Episode 2 - Second Dragon, Kanna! (We're Totally Spoiling Here)
Episode 3 - Start of a New Life! (That Doesn't Go Well, Of Course)
Episode 4 - Kanna Goes to School! (Not that she needs to.)
Episode 5 - Tohru's Real World Lessons! (She thinks she understands it already.)
Episode 6 - Home Visit! (And Homes Not Visited)
Episode 7 - Summer's Staples! (The Fanservice Episode, Frankly)
Episode 8 - New Dragon, Elma! (She's Finally Appearing, Huh?)
Episode 9 - Sports Festival! (There's No Twist Or Anything)
Episode 10 - Troupe Dragon, On Stage! (They Had A Troupe Name, Huh)
Episode 11 - Year End, New Year! (No Comiket Bit This Time)
Episode 12 - Tohru and Kobayashi's Impactful Meeting! (We're Raising the Bar on Ourselves)
Episode 13 - Emperor of Demise Arrives! (It Was the Final Episode Before We Knew It)
